newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks drift narrowly, hunt for direction.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks drift narrowly, hunt for direction.

text.p: Tokyo stocks drifted narrowly in Wednesday morning trade, hunting for concrete direction amidst thin trade, brokers said.
They said lingering worries over a brokerage scandal was discouraging investors from buying and bringing on arbitrage-linked sales from time to time.
Bargain hunters, however, were providing support lower down and preventing falls.
As of 0112 GMT, the Nikkei average was up 19.10 points or 0.09 percent at 20,194.62. Its September futures were up 120 at 20,220.
